newsitem.title: DUBAI: Emirates airline gets $118 mln loan for Boeing 777.
newsitem.headline: Emirates airline gets $118 mln loan for Boeing 777.

text.p: Dubai-owned Emirates airline said on Tuesday it signed a $118 million financing agreement with a consortium of local and international banks for the fourth of seven Boeing 777 twinjets on order.
An Emirates statement said the loan has a 12-year life and is priced on a LIBOR floating rate basis at a margin of 50 basis points.
The British Bank of the Middle East (BritishBank), a subsidiary of HSBC Holdings, the National Bank of Dubai and France's Societe General provided the financing, it said.
"The package was structured and arranged by BritishBank and the National Bank of Dubai, with the assistance of BritishBank's fellow HSBC Group member HSBC Investment Bank of Asia Ltd".
The aircraft, the first of longer-range planes set to join the company this year, is scheduled for delivery on April 11 and will arrive in Dubai a day after, the statement added.
Emirates has received three Boeing 777 of the seven on firm order. It has options on seven more 777s.
